verses.verse: (Praise for God’s Care for Jerusalem) (Ps 33.1; 135.3) Praise the LORD! How good it is to sing praises to our God, for he is gracious, and a song of praise is fitting.
(Deut 30.3; Ps 102.16) The LORD builds up Jerusalem; he gathers the outcasts of Israel.
(Isa 30.26; 61.1) He heals the brokenhearted and binds up their wounds.
(Isa 40.26) He determines the number of the stars; he gives to all of them their names.
(Ps 48.1; Isa 40.28) Great is our Lord and abundant in power; his understanding is beyond measure.
The LORD lifts up the downtrodden; he casts the wicked to the ground.
Sing to the LORD with thanksgiving; make melody to our God on the lyre.
(Job 38.26; Ps 104.13) He covers the heavens with clouds, prepares rain for the earth, makes grass grow on the hills.
(Job 38.41; Ps 104.27) He gives to the animals their food and to the young ravens when they cry.
(1 Sam 16.7; Ps 33.16, 17) His delight is not in the strength of the horse nor his pleasure in the speed of a runner, (Heb legs of a person)
but the LORD takes pleasure in those who fear him, in those who hope in his steadfast love.
Extol the LORD, O Jerusalem! Praise your God, O Zion!
For he strengthens the bars of your gates; he blesses your children within you.
(Ps 132.15; Isa 60.17) He grants peace (Or prosperity) within your borders; he fills you with the finest of wheat.
(Job 37.12; Ps 104.4) He sends out his command to the earth; his word runs swiftly.
(Job 37.6; 38.29) He gives snow like wool; he scatters frost like ashes.
He hurls down hail like crumbs— who can stand before his cold?
(Ps 33.9; 107.25) He sends out his word and melts them; he makes his wind blow, and the waters flow.
(Deut 33.2; Mal 4.4) He declares his word to Jacob, his statutes and ordinances to Israel.
(Deut 4.32) He has not dealt thus with any other nation; they do not know his ordinances. Praise the LORD!
